sentences.zh: 自古帝王之興，曷嘗不建輔弼之臣所與共成天功者乎！

translations.literal: Since ancient times, when emperors and kings rose to power, was there ever one who did not establish ministers of assistance with whom they shared in completing the heavenly merit?
translations.idiomatic: Since ancient times, when emperors and kings rose to power, was there ever one who did not establish ministers of assistance with whom they shared in completing the heavenly merit?

sentences.zh: 漢興自秦二世元年之秋，楚陳之歲，初以沛公總帥雄俊，三年然後西滅秦，立漢王之號，五年東克項羽，即皇帝位，八載而天下乃平，始論功而定封。

translations.literal: The Han rose from the autumn of Qin Ershi's first year, in the year of Chu and Chen, initially with Pei Gong commanding the heroic and outstanding, three years later they destroyed Qin in the west, established the title Han King, five years later conquered Xiang Yu in the east, assumed the emperor position, eight years and the realm was then pacified, then they evaluated merit and established enfeoffments.
translations.idiomatic: The Han dynasty rose in the autumn of Qin Ershi's first year, during the year when Chu and Chen were prominent. Initially, Pei Gong commanded the heroic and outstanding warriors. Three years later, they destroyed Qin in the west and established the title of Han King. Five years after that, they conquered Xiang Yu in the east and Pei Gong assumed the imperial throne. Eight years passed before the realm was finally pacified, and only then did they evaluate merits and establish enfeoffments.

sentences.zh: 訖十二年，侯者百四十有三人。

translations.literal: By the twelfth year, there were one hundred and forty-three marquises.
translations.idiomatic: By the twelfth year, there were one hundred and forty-three marquises.

sentences.zh: 時大城名都民人散亡，戶口可得而數裁什二三，是以大侯不過萬家，小者五六百戶。

translations.literal: At that time, the great cities and famous capitals had people scattered and lost, the registered households that could be counted were only two or three tenths, therefore great marquises had no more than ten thousand households, small ones five or six hundred households.
translations.idiomatic: At that time, people had scattered from the great cities and famous capitals. The registered households that could be counted amounted to only two or three tenths of the original number. Therefore, the greatest marquises had no more than ten thousand households, while the smallest had five or six hundred households.

sentences.zh: 封爵之誓曰：「使黃河如帶，泰山若厲，國以永存，爰及苗裔。」

translations.literal: The oath for enfeoffment and nobility said: 'May the Yellow River be like a belt, Mount Tai like a whetstone, the state eternally preserved, extending to descendants.'
translations.idiomatic: The oath for enfeoffment and nobility stated: 'May the Yellow River endure like a belt, Mount Tai stand firm like a whetstone, the state be eternally preserved, and this blessing extend to all descendants.'

sentences.zh: 於是申以丹書之信，重以白馬之盟，又作十八侯之位次。

translations.literal: Therefore they reinforced it with the trust of red writs, strengthened it with the white horse covenant, and moreover established the ranking order of the eighteen marquises.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, they reinforced the agreements with the trust of red writs and strengthened them with white horse covenants. They also established the ranking order of the eighteen marquises.

sentences.zh: 高后二年，復詔丞相陳平盡差列侯之功，錄弟下竟，臧諸宗廟，副在有司。

translations.literal: In Gao Hou's second year, they again commanded Chancellor Chen Ping to fully differentiate the merits of the marquises, record them from top to bottom, store them in the ancestral temple, with copies in the offices.
translations.idiomatic: In Empress Gao's second year, they again commanded Chancellor Chen Ping to fully differentiate and rank the merits of all the marquises. These records were made from highest to lowest ranking, stored in the ancestral temple, with copies kept in the appropriate offices.

sentences.zh: 始未嘗不欲固根本，而枝葉稍落也。

translations.literal: At the beginning they certainly desired to solidify the root, but the branches and leaves gradually fell.
translations.idiomatic: At the beginning, they certainly desired to strengthen the foundation, but the branches and leaves gradually fell away.

sentences.zh: 故逮文、景四五世間，流民既歸，戶口亦息，列侯大者至三四萬戶，小國自倍，富厚如之。

translations.literal: Therefore by the time of Wen and Jing, in four or five generations, the wandering people had returned, households had multiplied, great marquises reached thirty or forty thousand households, small states doubled, wealth and thickness likewise.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, by the time of Emperors Wen and Jing, over four or five generations, the displaced people had returned home and household registrations had increased. The greatest marquises now had thirty or forty thousand households, while the smallest states had doubled in size, with wealth and prosperity increasing accordingly.

sentences.zh: 子孫驕逸，忘其先祖之艱難，多陷法禁，���命亡國，云子孫。

translations.literal: Their descendants became arrogant and dissolute, forgot their ancestors' hardships, many fell into legal prohibitions, lost their lives and states, alas for the descendants.
translations.idiomatic: Their descendants became arrogant and dissolute, forgetting the hardships endured by their ancestors. Many fell into legal prohibitions, losing their lives and states. Alas for these descendants!

sentences.zh: 訖於孝武後元之年，靡有孑遺，耗矣。

translations.literal: By Xiaowu's Houyuan years, there was nothing left remaining, exhausted.
translations.idiomatic: By Emperor Wu's later years, nothing remained - it was all exhausted.

sentences.zh: 罔亦少密焉。

translations.literal: The net was also somewhat sparse.
translations.idiomatic: The net was also somewhat sparse.

sentences.zh: 故孝宣皇帝愍而錄之，乃開廟臧，覽舊籍，詔令有司求其子孫，咸出庸保之中，並受復除，或加以金帛，用章中興之德。

translations.literal: Therefore Emperor Xiaoxuan pitied and recorded them, opened the temple stores, examined the old registers, commanded the officials to seek their descendants, all emerged from among the common laborers, and received tax exemptions, some were additionally given gold and silk, to manifest the virtue of the restoration.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, Emperor Xiaoxuan took pity on them and had them recorded. He opened the temple archives and examined the old registers. He commanded the officials to seek out their descendants, who all emerged from among the common laborers. They all received tax exemptions, and some were additionally given gold and silk, to manifest the virtue of the restoration.

sentences.zh: 降及孝成，復加卹問，稍益衰微，不絕如悋。

translations.literal: Coming down to Xiaocheng, they again added compassion and inquiry, gradually increased the decline, not extinguished like a thread.
translations.idiomatic: Coming down to Emperor Cheng's reign, they again showed compassion and made inquiries. The decline gradually worsened, but it was not extinguished like a thread.

sentences.zh: 善乎，杜業之納說也！

translations.literal: Excellent, the advice given by Du Ye!
translations.idiomatic: Excellent, the advice given by Du Ye!

sentences.zh: 曰：「昔唐以萬國致時雍之政，虞、夏以之多群后饗共己之治。

translations.literal: He said: 'In ancient times, Tang achieved the governance of perfect harmony through ten thousand states, Yu and Xia used it to have many lords feast and share the rule.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'In ancient times, Yao achieved perfect harmony in governance through ten thousand states. Shun and Yu used this system to have many lords feast together and share in ruling.'

sentences.zh: 湯法三聖，殷氏太平。

translations.literal: Tang followed the three sages, and the Yin achieved great peace.
translations.idiomatic: Tang followed the three sages, and the Yin dynasty achieved great peace.

sentences.zh: 周封八百，重譯來賀。

translations.literal: Zhou enfeoffed eight hundred, and those from distant lands came to congratulate through multiple interpreters.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou enfeoffed eight hundred lords, and envoys from distant lands came to congratulate them through multiple interpreters.

sentences.zh: 是以內恕之君樂繼絕世，隆名之主安立亡國，至於不及下車，德念深矣。

translations.literal: Therefore benevolent rulers delight in continuing extinct lines, illustrious sovereigns peacefully establish fallen states, their virtue extends even before alighting from their chariot, their thoughts of benevolence are profound.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, benevolent rulers delight in continuing extinct noble lines, and illustrious sovereigns peacefully reestablish fallen states. Their virtue extends even to regions they haven't yet visited by chariot, and their thoughts of benevolence run deep.

sentences.zh: 成王察牧野之克，顧群后之勤，知其恩結於民心，功光於王府也，故追述先父之志，錄遺老之策，高其位，大其驱，愛敬飭盡，命賜備厚。

translations.literal: King Cheng examined the victory at Muye, considered the diligence of the many lords, knew that their favor was tied to the people's hearts, their merit shone in the royal domain, therefore he traced his late father's intentions, recorded the strategies of the aged retainers, elevated their positions, enlarged their territories, exhausted love and respect, and bestowed complete generosity in commands and gifts.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng examined the victory at Muye and considered the diligence of the many lords. He knew that their favor was tied to the people's hearts and their merit shone brightly in the royal domain. Therefore, he traced his late father's intentions and recorded the strategies of the aged retainers. He elevated their positions, enlarged their territories, exhausted all expressions of love and respect, and bestowed the most generous commands and gifts.

sentences.zh: 大孝之隆，於是為至。

translations.literal: The flourishing of great filial piety reached its peak here.
translations.idiomatic: The flourishing of great filial piety reached its peak here.

sentences.zh: 至其沒也，世主歎其功，無民而不思。

translations.literal: When they died, the rulers of generations sighed at their merit, there was no one among the people who did not think of them.
translations.idiomatic: When they died, rulers of successive generations sighed at their merit. There was no one among the people who did not think of them fondly.

sentences.zh: 所息之樹且猶不伐，況其廟乎？

translations.literal: Even the trees they rested under were not cut down, how much less their temples?
translations.idiomatic: Even the trees under which they rested were not cut down—how much less would their temples be harmed?

sentences.zh: 是以燕、齊之祀與周並傳，子繼弟及，歷載不墮。

translations.literal: Therefore the sacrifices of Yan and Qi were transmitted alongside Zhou, son succeeding father and brother following brother, through the years without decline.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the sacrificial rites of Yan and Qi were transmitted alongside those of Zhou. Sons succeeded fathers and brothers followed brothers, enduring through the years without interruption.

sentences.zh: 豈無刑辟，繇祖之竭力，故支庶賴焉。

translations.literal: Was it not without punishments and laws? Because of the ancestors' exhausting efforts, the collateral lines depended on it.
translations.idiomatic: Were there no punishments and laws? It was because of the ancestors' exhausting efforts that the collateral branches depended on them.

sentences.zh: 跡漢功臣，亦皆割符世爵，受山河之誓，存以著其號，亡以顯其魂，賞亦不細矣。

translations.literal: Tracing Han's meritorious ministers, they all received divided tallies for hereditary nobility, accepted oaths by mountains and rivers, in life to make their titles clear, in death to manifest their spirits, the rewards were not insignificant.
translations.idiomatic: Tracing the meritorious ministers of the Han dynasty, they all received divided tallies granting hereditary nobility and accepted oaths sworn by mountains and rivers. In life, these clarified their titles; in death, they manifested their spirits. The rewards were certainly not insignificant.

sentences.zh: 百餘年間而襲封者盡，或絕失姓，或乏無主，朽骨孤於墓，苗裔流於道，生為愍隸，死為轉屍。

translations.literal: In more than a hundred years, those who inherited the enfeoffments were all gone, some lines extinct and surnames lost, some lacking heirs, decayed bones isolated in tombs, descendants wandering on the roads, in life miserable slaves, in death rolling corpses.
translations.idiomatic: Over more than a hundred years, all those who inherited the enfeoffments disappeared. Some noble lines became extinct and lost their surnames; others lacked heirs. Decayed bones lay isolated in tombs; descendants wandered the roads. In life they were miserable slaves; in death, their bodies were abandoned.

sentences.zh: 以往況今，甚可悲傷。

translations.literal: Using the past to consider the present, it is extremely lamentable.
translations.idiomatic: Using the past to reflect on the present situation, it is extremely lamentable.

sentences.zh: 聖朝憐閔，詔求其後，四方忻忻，靡不歸心。

translations.literal: The sagely court took pity, commanded to seek their descendants, the four quarters rejoiced, none did not return their hearts.
translations.idiomatic: The sagely court took pity and commanded officials to seek out their descendants. The four quarters rejoiced, and none failed to return their allegiance.

sentences.zh: 出入數年而不省察，恐議者不思大義，設言虛亡，則厚德掩息，遴柬布章，非所以視化勸後也。

translations.literal: After several years without inspection and examination, I fear critics will not consider the great righteousness, fabricate words of false extinction, then thick virtue will be concealed and cease, selecting the worthy will be broadly proclaimed, which is not the way to demonstrate transformation and encourage posterity.
translations.idiomatic: After several years without proper inspection and examination, I fear that critics will fail to consider the great righteousness and fabricate claims of false extinction. Then the court's abundant virtue will be concealed and cease, the selection of worthy descendants will be broadly proclaimed, which is not the proper way to demonstrate moral transformation and encourage future generations.

sentences.zh: 三人為眾，雖難盡繼，宜從尤功。」

translations.literal: Three people constitute a crowd, though difficult to all continue, should follow those with outstanding merit.'
translations.idiomatic: Three people constitute a crowd. Though it is difficult to continue all of them, we should follow those with outstanding merit.'

sentences.zh: 於是成帝復紹蕭何。

translations.literal: Therefore Emperor Cheng again continued Xiao He's line.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, Emperor Cheng again continued the line of Xiao He.

sentences.zh: 哀、平之世，增修曹參、周勃之屬，得其宜矣。

translations.literal: In the eras of Ai and Ping, they added and repaired those like Cao Can and Zhou Bo, obtaining what was appropriate.
translations.idiomatic: During the reigns of Emperors Ai and Ping, they added to and repaired the lines of those like Cao Can and Zhou Bo, achieving what was appropriate.

sentences.zh: 以綴續前記，究其本末，并序位次，盡于孝文，以昭元功之候籍云。

translations.literal: To connect and continue the previous records, investigate their origins and ends, and arrange their positions in order, ending with Xiaowen, to illuminate the registers of the original meritorious marquises.
translations.idiomatic: This connects and continues the previous records, investigating their origins and outcomes, arranging their positions in order, and ending with Emperor Wen, to illuminate the registers of the original meritorious marquises.

sentences.zh: 號諡姓名

translations.literal: Title, posthumous name, personal name
translations.idiomatic: Title, Posthumous Name, Personal Name

sentences.zh: 侯狀戶數

translations.literal: Marquis's condition, household count
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Status, Household Count

sentences.zh: 始封

translations.literal: Initial enfeoffment
translations.idiomatic: Initial Enfeoffment

sentences.zh: 位次

translations.literal: Position ranking
translations.idiomatic: Position Rank

sentences.zh: 子

translations.literal: Son
translations.idiomatic: Son

sentences.zh: 孫

translations.literal: Grandson
translations.idiomatic: Grandson

sentences.zh: 曾孫

translations.literal: Great-grandson
translations.idiomatic: Great-grandson

sentences.zh: 玄孫

translations.literal: Great-great-grandson
translations.idiomatic: Great-great-grandson

cells.content: 平陽懿侯曹參
cells.literal: Pingyang Yi Marquis Cao Can
cells.idiomatic: Pingyang Yi Marquis Cao Can

cells.content: 以中涓從起沛，至霸上，侯。以將軍入漢，以假左丞相定魏、齊，以右丞相，侯，萬六百戶。
cells.literal: As attendant-in-ordinary followed from Pei to Baxiang, made marquis. As general entered Han, as acting Left Chancellor pacified Wei and Qi, as Right Chancellor, marquis, sixteen hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: As an attendant-in-ordinary, he followed the uprising from Pei to Baxiang and was made a marquis. As a general, he entered the Han service. As acting Left Chancellor, he pacified Wei and Qi. As Right Chancellor, he was made a marquis with sixteen hundred households.

cells.content: 六年十二月甲申封，十二年薨。
cells.literal: Sixth year twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, twelfth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month in the sixth year; died in the twelfth year.

cells.content: 孝惠六年，靖侯窋嗣，二十九年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaohui sixth year, Jing Marquis Kun succeeded; died after twenty-nine years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Hui's sixth year, Jing Marquis Kun succeeded to the marquisate; died after twenty-nine years.

cells.content: 孝文後四年，簡侯奇嗣，七年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen Hou fourth year, Jian Marquis Ji succeeded; died after seven years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of the Xiaowen Hou period, Jian Marquis Ji succeeded to the marquisate; died after seven years.

cells.content: 孝景四年，夷侯時嗣，二十三年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaojing fourth year, Yi Marquis Shi succeeded; died after twenty-three years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's fourth year, Yi Marquis Shi succeeded to the marquisate; died after twenty-three years.

cells.content: 元光五年，共侯襄嗣，十六年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanguang fifth year, Gong Marquis Xiang succeeded; died after sixteen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Yuanguang, Gong Marquis Xiang succeeded to the marquisate; died after sixteen years.

cells.content: 六世元鼎二年，侯宗嗣，二十四年，征和二年，坐與中人姦，闌入宮掖門，入財贖完為城旦。戶二萬三千。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yuanding second year, Marquis Zong succeeded; twenty-fourth year, Zhenghe second year, convicted of adultery with palace attendants, forcibly entering the palace inner gates, paid money to redeem punishment and became city laborer. Households twenty-three thousand.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanding of the sixth generation, Marquis Zong succeeded to the marquisate; in the twenty-fourth year, during the second year of Zhenghe, he was convicted of adultery with palace attendants and forcibly entering the inner palace gates. He paid money to redeem his punishment and became a city laborer. The marquisate had twenty-three thousand households.

cells.content: 七世元康四年，參玄孫之孫杜陵公乘喜詔復家。
cells.literal: Seventh generation Yuankang fourth year, Cao Can's great-great-grandson's grandson Duling Gongcheng Xi commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang of the seventh generation, Cao Can's great-great-grandson's grandson, Duling Gongcheng Xi, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 八世
cells.literal: Eighth generation
cells.idiomatic: Eighth generation

cells.content: 九世元壽二年五月甲子，侯本始以參玄孫之玄孫杜陵公士紹封，千戶，元始元年益滿二千戶。
cells.literal: Ninth generation Yuanshou second year fifth month Jiazi day, Marquis Benshi succeeded as Cao Can's great-great-great-grandson's grandson Duling Goshi, enfeoffed with one thousand households, Yuanshi first year increased to full two thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: In the ninth generation, on the Jiazi day of the fifth month in the second year of Yuanshou, Marquis Benshi succeeded as Cao Can's great-great-great-grandson's grandson, Duling Goshi. He was enfeoffed with one thousand households, and in the first year of Yuanshi, this was increased to the full two thousand households.

cells.content: 十世建武二年，侯宏嗣，以本始子舉兵佐軍，紹封。
cells.literal: Tenth generation Jianwu second year, Marquis Hong succeeded, as Benshi's son raised troops to assist the army, continued the enfeoffment.
cells.idiomatic: In the tenth generation, during the second year of Jianwu, Marquis Hong succeeded to the marquisate. As Benshi's son, he had raised troops to assist the army, so the enfeoffment was continued.

cells.content: 十一世侯曠嗣，今見。
cells.literal: Eleventh generation Marquis Kuang succeeded, currently visible.
cells.idiomatic: In the eleventh generation, Marquis Kuang succeeded to the marquisate; he is currently living.

cells.content: 信武肅侯靳歙
cells.literal: Xinwu Su Marquis Jin Xi
cells.idiomatic: Xinwu Su Marquis Jin Xi

cells.content: 以中涓從起宛朐，入漢，以騎都尉定三秦，擊項籍，別定江漢，侯，五千三百戶。以將軍攻豨、布。
cells.literal: As attendant-in-ordinary followed uprising from Wanqu, entered Han, as cavalry commander pacified the Three Qins, attacked Xiang Yu, separately pacified Jiang and Han, made marquis, five thousand three hundred households. As general attacked Peng and Bu.
cells.idiomatic: As an attendant-in-ordinary, he followed the uprising from Wanqu and entered Han service. As cavalry commander, he pacified the Three Qin territories. He attacked Xiang Yu and separately pacified the Jiang and Han regions, becoming a marquis with five thousand three hundred households. As a general, he attacked Peng Yue and Ying Bu.

cells.content: 十二月甲申封，九年薨。
cells.literal: Twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, ninth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month; died in the ninth year.

cells.content: 十一
cells.literal: Eleven
cells.idiomatic: Eleven

cells.content: 高后六年，侯亭嗣，二十一年，孝文後三年，坐事國人過律，免。
cells.literal: Gao Hou sixth year, Marquis Ting succeeded; twenty-first year, Xiaowen Hou third year, convicted of violating the law regarding the state people, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In Empress Gao's sixth year, Marquis Ting succeeded to the marquisate; in the twenty-first year, during the third year of the Xiaowen Hou period, he was convicted of violating the law regarding the state people and was dismissed from office.

cells.content: 孫
cells.literal: Grandson
cells.idiomatic: Grandson

cells.content: 曾孫
cells.literal: Great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-grandson

cells.content: 玄孫
cells.literal: Great-great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-great-grandson

cells.content: 六世元康四年，歙玄孫之子長安上造安漢詔復家。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yuankang fourth year, Jin Xi's great-great-grandson's son Chang'an Shangzao Anhan commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang of the sixth generation, Jin Xi's great-great-grandson's son, Chang'an Shangzao Anhan, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 汝陰文侯夏侯嬰
cells.literal: Ruyin Wen Marquis Xiahou Ying
cells.idiomatic: Ruyin Wen Marquis Xiahou Ying

cells.content: 以令史從降沛，為太僕，常奉車，竟定天下，及全皇太子、魯元公主，侯，六千九百戶。
cells.literal: As clerk followed surrender at Pei, became Grand Coachman, constantly drove the carriage, ultimately pacified the realm, and preserved the Crown Prince and Princess Lu Yuan, made marquis, six thousand nine hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: As a clerk, he followed the surrender at Pei and became the Grand Coachman. He constantly drove the imperial carriage, ultimately helped pacify the realm, and preserved the Crown Prince and Princess Lu Yuan. He was made a marquis with six thousand nine hundred households.

cells.content: 十二月甲申封，三十年薨。
cells.literal: Twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, thirtieth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month; died in the thirtieth year.

cells.content: 八
cells.literal: Eight
cells.idiomatic: Eight

cells.content: 孝文九年，夷侯灶嗣，七年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen ninth year, Yi Marquis Zao succeeded; died after seven years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's ninth year, Yi Marquis Zao succeeded to the marquisate; died after seven years.

cells.content: 十六年，共侯賜嗣，四十一年薨。
cells.literal: Sixteenth year, Gong Marquis Ci succeeded; died after forty-one years.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Gong Marquis Ci succeeded to the marquisate; died after forty-one years.

cells.content: 元光二年，侯頗嗣，十八年，元鼎二年，坐尚公立與父御婢姦，自殺。
cells.literal: Yuanguang second year, Marquis Po succeeded; eighteenth year, Yuanding second year, convicted of Princess Shang having illicit relations with father's concubine, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanguang, Marquis Po succeeded to the marquisate; in the eighteenth year, during the second year of Yuanding, he was convicted because Princess Shang had illicit relations with her father's concubine, and he committed suicide.

cells.content: 玄孫
cells.literal: Great-great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-great-grandson

cells.content: 六世元康四年，嬰玄孫之子長安大夫信詔復家。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yuankang fourth year, Xiahou Ying's great-great-grandson's son Chang'an Dafu Xin commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang of the sixth generation, Xiahou Ying's great-great-grandson's son, Chang'an Dafu Xin, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 清河定侯王吸
cells.literal: Qinghe Ding Marquis Wang Xi
cells.idiomatic: Qinghe Ding Marquis Wang Xi

cells.content: 以中涓從起豐，至霸上，為騎郎將，入漢，以將軍擊項籍，侯，二千二百戶。
cells.literal: As attendant-in-ordinary followed uprising from Feng, to Baxiang, became cavalry lieutenant general, entered Han, as general attacked Xiang Yu, made marquis, two thousand two hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: As an attendant-in-ordinary, he followed the uprising from Feng to Baxiang and became cavalry lieutenant general. He entered Han service and, as a general, attacked Xiang Yu. He was made a marquis with two thousand two hundred households.

cells.content: 十二月甲申封，二十三年薨。
cells.literal: Twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, twenty-third year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month; died in the twenty-third year.

cells.content: 十四
cells.literal: Fourteen
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen

cells.content: 孝文元年，哀侯疆嗣。七年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen first year, Ai Marquis Jiang succeeded. Died after seven years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's first year, Ai Marquis Jiang succeeded to the marquisate. He died after seven years.

cells.content: 八年，孝侯伉嗣，二十年薨。
cells.literal: Eighth year, Xiao Marquis Kang succeeded; died after twenty years.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Xiao Marquis Kang succeeded to the marquisate; died after twenty years.

cells.content: 孝景五年，哀侯不害嗣，十九年，元光二年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Xiaojing fifth year, Ai Marquis Buhai succeeded; nineteenth year, Yuanguang second year died, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's fifth year, Ai Marquis Buhai succeeded to the marquisate; in the nineteenth year, during the second year of Yuanguang, he died with no heir.

cells.content: 元康四年，吸玄孫長安大夫充國詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Wang Xi's great-great-grandson Chang'an Dafu Chongguo commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Wang Xi's great-great-grandson, Chang'an Dafu Chongguo, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 元壽二年八月，詔賜吸代後爵關內侯，不言世。
cells.literal: Yuanshou second year eighth month, commanded to grant Wang Xi's substitute heir the rank of Guan Nei Marquis, not specifying generations.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth month of the second year of Yuanshou, it was commanded that Wang Xi's substitute heir be granted the rank of Guan Nei Marquis, without specifying the number of generations.

cells.content: 陽陵景侯傅寬
cells.literal: Yangling Jing Marquis Fu Kuan
cells.idiomatic: Yangling Jing Marquis Fu Kuan

cells.content: 以舍人從起橫陽，至霸上，為騎將，入漢，定三秦，屬淮陰，定齊，為齊丞相，侯，二千六百戶。
cells.literal: As retainer followed uprising from Hengyang, to Baxiang, became cavalry general, entered Han, pacified the Three Qins, served under Huaiyin, pacified Qi, became Qi Chancellor, made marquis, two thousand six hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: As a retainer, he followed the uprising from Hengyang to Baxiang and became a cavalry general. He entered Han service, pacified the Three Qin territories, served under Han Xin, pacified Qi, became Chancellor of Qi, and was made a marquis with two thousand six hundred households.

cells.content: 十二月甲申封，十二年薨。
cells.literal: Twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, twelfth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month; died in the twelfth year.

cells.content: 十位次曰武忠侯。
cells.literal: Tenth in ranking called Martial Loyal Marquis.
cells.idiomatic: He ranked tenth and was called the Martial Loyal Marquis.

cells.content: 孝惠六年，頃侯清嗣，二十二年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaohui sixth year, Qing Marquis Qing succeeded; died after twenty-two years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Hui's sixth year, Qing Marquis Qing succeeded to the marquisate; died after twenty-two years.

cells.content: 孝文十五年，共侯明嗣，二十二年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen fifteenth year, Gong Marquis Ming succeeded; died after twenty-two years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's fifteenth year, Gong Marquis Ming succeeded to the marquisate; died after twenty-two years.

cells.content: 孝景四年，侯偃嗣，三十一年，元狩元年，坐與淮南王謀反，誅。
cells.literal: Xiaojing fourth year, Marquis Yan succeeded; thirty-first year, Yuanshou first year, convicted of plotting rebellion with Huainan King, executed.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's fourth year, Marquis Yan succeeded to the marquisate; in the thirty-first year, during the first year of Yuanshou, he was convicted of plotting rebellion with the Huainan King and executed.

cells.content: 玄孫
cells.literal: Great-great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-great-grandson

cells.content: 六世
cells.literal: Sixth generation
cells.idiomatic: Sixth generation

cells.content: 七世元康四年，寬玄孫之孫長陵士伍景詔復家。
cells.literal: Seventh generation Yuankang fourth year, Fu Kuan's great-great-grandson's grandson Changling Shiwu Jing commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the seventh generation, during the fourth year of Yuankang, Fu Kuan's great-great-grandson's grandson, Changling Shiwu Jing, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 廣嚴侯召歐
cells.literal: Guangyan Marquis Zhao Ou
cells.idiomatic: Guangyan Marquis Zhao Ou

cells.content: 以中涓從起沛，至霸上，為連敖，入漢，以騎將定燕、趙，得燕將軍，侯，二千二百戶。
cells.literal: As attendant-in-ordinary followed uprising from Pei, to Baxiang, became Lian Ao, entered Han, as cavalry general pacified Yan and Zhao, captured Yan general, made marquis, two thousand two hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: As an attendant-in-ordinary, he followed the uprising from Pei to Baxiang and became Lian Ao. He entered Han service and, as a cavalry general, pacified Yan and Zhao territories. He captured the Yan general and was made a marquis with two thousand two hundred households.

cells.content: 十二月甲申封，二十三年薨。
cells.literal: Twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, twenty-third year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month; died in the twenty-third year.

cells.content: 二十八
cells.literal: Twenty-eight
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eight

cells.content: 孝文二年，戴侯勝嗣，九年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen second year, Dai Marquis Sheng succeeded; died after nine years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's second year, Dai Marquis Sheng succeeded to the marquisate; died after nine years.

cells.content: 十一年，共侯嘉嗣，十三年，孝文後七年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Eleventh year, Gong Marquis Jia succeeded; thirteenth year, Xiaowen Hou seventh year died, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Gong Marquis Jia succeeded to the marquisate; in the thirteenth year, during the seventh year of the Xiaowen Hou period, he died with no heir.

cells.content: 曾孫
cells.literal: Great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-grandson

cells.content: 元康四年，歐玄孫安陵大夫不識詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Zhao Ou's great-great-grandson Anling Dafu Bushi commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Zhao Ou's great-great-grandson, Anling Dafu Bushi, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 廣平敬侯薛歐
cells.literal: Guangping Jing Marquis Xue Ou
cells.idiomatic: Guangping Jing Marquis Xue Ou

cells.content: 以舍人從起豐，至霸上，為郎，入漢，以將軍擊項籍將鍾離眛，侯，四千五百戶。
cells.literal: As retainer followed uprising from Feng, to Baxiang, became attendant, entered Han, as general attacked Xiang Yu's general Zhongli Mo, made marquis, four thousand five hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: As a retainer, he followed the uprising from Feng to Baxiang and became an attendant. He entered Han service and, as a general, attacked Xiang Yu's general Zhongli Mo. He was made a marquis with four thousand five hundred households.

cells.content: 十二月甲申封，十四年薨。
cells.literal: Twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, fourteenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month; died in the fourteenth year.

cells.content: 十五
cells.literal: Fifteen
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen

cells.content: 高后元年，靖侯山嗣，二十六年薨。
cells.literal: Gao Hou first year, Jing Marquis Shan succeeded; died after twenty-six years.
cells.idiomatic: In Empress Gao's first year, Jing Marquis Shan succeeded to the marquisate; died after twenty-six years.

cells.content: 平棘孝文後三年，侯澤嗣，孝景中三年，有罪，免。中五年，澤復封，三十三年薨，諡曰節侯。
cells.literal: Pingji Xiaowen Hou third year, Marquis Ze succeeded; Xiaojing middle third year, guilty, dismissed. Middle fifth year, Ze re-enfeoffed, died after thirty-three years, posthumous name Jie Marquis.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of the Pingji Xiaowen Hou period, Marquis Ze succeeded to the marquisate; in the middle third year of Xiaojing, he was found guilty and dismissed. In the middle fifth year, Ze was re-enfeoffed and died after thirty-three years, receiving the posthumous name Jie Marquis.

cells.content: 元朔四年，侯穰嗣，三年，元狩元年，坐受淮南賂稱臣，在赦前，免。
cells.literal: Yuanshuo fourth year, Marquis Rang succeeded; third year, Yuanshou first year, convicted of accepting Huainan bribes and calling himself subject, before amnesty, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuanshuo, Marquis Rang succeeded to the marquisate; in the third year, during the first year of Yuanshou, he was convicted of accepting bribes from Huainan and calling himself a subject. Since this was before the amnesty, he was dismissed.

cells.content: 元康四年，歐玄孫長安大夫去病詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Zhao Ou's great-great-grandson Chang'an Dafu Qubing commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Zhao Ou's great-great-grandson, Chang'an Dafu Qubing, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 博陽嚴侯陳濞
cells.literal: Boyang Yan Marquis Chen Pi
cells.idiomatic: Boyang Yan Marquis Chen Pi

cells.content: 以舍人從碭，以刺客將入漢，以都尉擊項羽滎陽，絕甬道，殺追士卒，侯。
cells.literal: As retainer followed Dang, as assassin general entered Han, as commander attacked Xiang Yu at Xingyang, cut off the passage, killed pursuing soldiers, made marquis.
cells.idiomatic: As a retainer, he followed Dang and entered Han as an assassin general. As a commander, he attacked Xiang Yu at Xingyang, cut off the passage, and killed the pursuing soldiers, for which he was made a marquis.

cells.content: 十二月甲申封，三十年薨。
cells.literal: Twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, thirtieth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month; died in the thirtieth year.

cells.content: 十九
cells.literal: Nineteen
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen

cells.content: 塞孝文後三年，侯始嗣，九年，坐謀殺人，會赦，免。孝景中五年，始復封，二年，後元年，有罪，免。
cells.literal: Sai Xiaowen Hou third year, Marquis Shi succeeded; ninth year, convicted of plotting murder, met with amnesty, dismissed. Xiaojing middle fifth year, Shi re-enfeoffed; second year, Hou first year, guilty, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of the Sai Xiaowen Hou period, Marquis Shi succeeded to the marquisate; in the ninth year, he was convicted of plotting murder but met with an amnesty and was dismissed. In the middle fifth year of Xiaojing, Shi was re-enfeoffed; in the second year, during the Hou first year, he was found guilty again and dismissed.

cells.content: 孫
cells.literal: Grandson
cells.idiomatic: Grandson

cells.content: 元康四年，濞曾孫茂陵公乘壽詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Chen Pi's great-grandson Maoling Gongcheng Shou commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Chen Pi's great-grandson, Maoling Gongcheng Shou, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 堂邑安侯陳嬰
cells.literal: Tangyi An Marquis Chen Ying
cells.idiomatic: Tangyi An Marquis Chen Ying

cells.content: 以自定東陽為將，屬楚項梁，為楚柱國。四歲，項羽死，屬漢，定豫章、浙江，都漸，定自為王壯息，侯，六百戶。復相楚元王十二年。
cells.literal: As general self-pacified Dongyang, belonged to Chu Xiang Liang, became Chu Zhu Guo. Fourth year, Xiang Yu died, belonged to Han, pacified Yuzhang and Zhejiang, commanded Jian, pacified and became king Zhuang Xi, made marquis, six hundred households. Again served as chancellor to Chu Yuan Wang for twelve years.
cells.idiomatic: He became a general by personally pacifying Dongyang and belonged to Chu under Xiang Liang, becoming Chu's Zhu Guo. In the fourth year, after Xiang Yu's death, he belonged to Han and pacified Yuzhang and Zhejiang. He commanded Jian, pacified the region, and was established as King Zhuang Xi. He was made a marquis with six hundred households. He later served as chancellor to Chu Yuan Wang for twelve years.

cells.content: 十二月甲申封，十八年薨。
cells.literal: Twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, eighteenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month; died in the eighteenth year.

cells.content: 八十六
cells.literal: Eighty-six
cells.idiomatic: Eighty-six

cells.content: 高后五年，共侯祿嗣，十八年薨。
cells.literal: Gao Hou fifth year, Gong Marquis Lu succeeded; died after eighteen years.
cells.idiomatic: In Empress Gao's fifth year, Gong Marquis Lu succeeded to the marquisate; died after eighteen years.

cells.content: 孝文三年，侯午嗣，尚館陶公主，四十八年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen third year, Marquis Wu succeeded, married Guantao Princess, died after forty-eight years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's third year, Marquis Wu succeeded to the marquisate and married Princess Guantao; died after forty-eight years.

cells.content: 元光六年，侯季須嗣。十三年，元鼎元年，坐母公主卒未除服姦，兄弟爭財，當死，自殺。
cells.literal: Yuanguang sixth year, Marquis Ji Xu succeeded. Thirteenth year, Yuanding first year, convicted of adultery with mother princess while not out of mourning clothes, brothers fought over property, sentenced to death, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth year of Yuanguang, Marquis Ji Xu succeeded to the marquisate. In the thirteenth year, during the first year of Yuanding, he was convicted of adultery with his mother the princess while still in mourning clothes, and his brothers fought over property. He was sentenced to death and committed suicide.

cells.content: 隆慮孝景中五年，侯融以長公主子侯，萬五千戶，二十九年，坐母喪未除服姦，自殺。
cells.literal: Longlu Xiaojing middle fifth year, Marquis Rong made marquis as eldest princess's son, fifteen thousand households, twenty-ninth year, convicted of adultery while mother in mourning, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: In the middle fifth year of Emperor Jing, Marquis Rong of Longlu was made a marquis as the son of the eldest princess, with fifteen thousand households. In the twenty-ninth year, he was convicted of adultery while his mother was in mourning and committed suicide.

cells.content: 六世元康四年，嬰玄孫之子霸陵公士尊詔復家。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yuankang fourth year, Ying's great-great-grandson's son Baling Gongshi Zun commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth generation, during the fourth year of Yuankang, Chen Ying's great-great-grandson's son, Baling Gongshi Zun, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 曲逆獻侯陳平
cells.literal: Qu Ni Xian Marquis Chen Ping
cells.idiomatic: Qu Ni Xian Marquis Chen Ping

cells.content: 以故楚都尉，漢王二年初起修武，為都尉，以護軍中尉出奇計，定天下，侯，五千戶。
cells.literal: As former Chu commander, Han King second year initially rose at Xiuwu, became commander, as protector army central commander devised extraordinary strategies, pacified the realm, made marquis, five thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: As a former Chu commander, he initially rose up with the Han King in the second year at Xiuwu and became a commander. As protector army central commander, he devised extraordinary strategies that pacified the realm. He was made a marquis with five thousand households.

cells.content: 十二月甲申封，二十四年薨。
cells.literal: Twelfth month Jia Shen day enfeoffed, twenty-fourth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Shen day of the twelfth month; died in the twenty-fourth year.

cells.content: 四十七
cells.literal: Forty-seven
cells.idiomatic: Forty-seven

cells.content: 孝文三年，共侯買嗣，二年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen third year, Gong Marquis Mai succeeded, died after two years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's third year, Gong Marquis Mai succeeded to the marquisate; died after two years.

cells.content: 五年，簡侯悝嗣，二十二年薨。
cells.literal: Fifth year, Jian Marquis Kui succeeded, died after twenty-two years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Jian Marquis Kui succeeded to the marquisate; died after twenty-two years.

cells.content: 孝景五年，侯何嗣，二十三年，元光五年，坐略人妻，棄市。戶萬六千。
cells.literal: Xiaojing fifth year, Marquis He succeeded; twenty-third year, Yuanguang fifth year, convicted of abducting someone's wife, executed in market. Households sixteen thousand.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's fifth year, Marquis He succeeded to the marquisate; in the twenty-third year, during the fifth year of Yuanguang, he was convicted of abducting someone's wife and executed in the marketplace. His fief had sixteen thousand households.

cells.content: 六世元康四年，平玄孫之子長安簪褭莫詔復家。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yuankang fourth year, Ping's great-great-grandson's son Chang'an Zanliao Mo commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth generation, during the fourth year of Yuankang, Chen Ping's great-great-grandson's son, Chang'an Zanliao Mo, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 元始二年，詔賜平代後者鳳爵關內侯，不言世。
cells.literal: Yuanshi second year, commanded to grant Ping's substitute heir Feng rank Guan Nei Marquis, not specifying generations.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanshi, it was commanded that Chen Ping's substitute heir be granted the Feng rank of Guan Nei Marquis, without specifying the number of generations.

cells.content: 留文成侯張良
cells.literal: Liu Wen Cheng Marquis Zhang Liang
cells.idiomatic: Liu Wen Cheng Marquis Zhang Liang

cells.content: 以廄將從起下邳，以韓申都下韓，入武關，設策降秦王嬰，解上與項羽缝，請漢中地，常為計謀，侯，萬戶。
cells.literal: As stable officer followed uprising at Xiapi, with Han Shen captured Han capital, entered Wuguan, devised strategy to surrender Qin King Ying, relieved siege with Xiang Yu, requested Hanzhong land, constantly provided strategies, made marquis, ten thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: As a stable officer, he followed the uprising at Xiapi and, along with Han Shen, captured the Han capital. They entered Wuguan Pass and devised a strategy that led to the surrender of Qin King Ying. They relieved the siege against Liu Bang by Xiang Yu and requested Hanzhong territory. He constantly provided strategies and was made a marquis with ten thousand households.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，十六年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, sixteenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the sixteenth year.

cells.content: 六十二
cells.literal: Sixty-two
cells.idiomatic: Sixty-two

cells.content: 高后三年，侯不疑嗣，十年，孝文五年，坐與門大夫殺故楚內史，贖為城旦。
cells.literal: Gao Hou third year, Marquis Buyi succeeded; tenth year, Xiaowen fifth year, convicted of killing former Chu interior minister with gate official, redeemed as walled laborer.
cells.idiomatic: In Empress Gao's third year, Marquis Buyi succeeded to the marquisate; in the tenth year, during the fifth year of Xiaowen, he was convicted of killing the former Chu interior minister along with a gate official and was redeemed as a walled laborer.

cells.content: 孫
cells.literal: Grandson
cells.idiomatic: Grandson

cells.content: 曾孫
cells.literal: Great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-grandson

cells.content: 玄孫
cells.literal: Great-great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-great-grandson

cells.content: 六世元康四年，良玄孫之子陽陵公乘千秋詔復家。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yuankang fourth year, Liang's great-great-grandson's son Yangling Gongcheng Qianqiu commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth generation, during the fourth year of Yuankang, Zhang Liang's great-great-grandson's son, Yangling Gongcheng Qianqiu, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 射陽侯劉纏
cells.literal: Sheyang Marquis Liu Chan
cells.idiomatic: Sheyang Marquis Liu Chan

cells.content: 兵初起，與諸侯共擊秦，為楚左令尹。漢王與項有隙於鴻門，纏解難，以破羽降漢，侯。
cells.literal: When troops first rose, together with lords attacked Qin, became Chu left prime minister. Han King had conflict with Xiang at Hongmen, Chan resolved the difficulty, by defeating Yu surrendered to Han, made marquis.
cells.idiomatic: When troops first rose up, he joined with the other lords to attack Qin and became Chu's left prime minister. When the Han King had a conflict with Xiang Yu at Hongmen, Chan resolved the difficulty and, by defeating Xiang Yu, surrendered to Han and was made a marquis.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，九年，孝惠三年薨。嗣子睢有罪，不得代。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, ninth year, Xiaohui third year died. Successor son Sui had crime, could not succeed.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the ninth year, during the third year of Xiaohui. His successor son Sui committed a crime and could not succeed to the marquisate.

cells.content: 酇文終侯蕭何
cells.literal: Tan Wen Zhong Marquis Xiao He
cells.idiomatic: Tan Wen Zhong Marquis Xiao He

cells.content: 以客初從入漢，為丞相，守蜀及關中，給軍食，佐定諸侯，為法令宗廟，侯，八千戶。
cells.literal: As guest initially followed into Han, became chancellor, defended Shu and Guanzhong, supplied army provisions, assisted in pacifying the lords, established laws and ancestral temples, made marquis, eight thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: As a guest, he initially followed Liu Bang into Han service and became chancellor. He defended Shu and Guanzhong, supplied the army with provisions, assisted in pacifying the other lords, established laws and ancestral temples, and was made a marquis with eight thousand households.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，九年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, ninth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the ninth year.

cells.content: 一
cells.literal: One
cells.idiomatic: One

cells.content: 孝惠三年，哀侯祿嗣，六年薨，亡後。高后二年，封何夫人祿母同為侯，孝文元年罷。
cells.literal: Xiaohui third year, Ai Marquis Lu succeeded, sixth year died, no heir. Gao Hou second year, enfeoffed Xiao He's wife Lu's mother as marquis together. Xiaowen first year dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Xiaohui, Ai Marquis Lu succeeded to the marquisate; died in the sixth year with no heir. In the second year of Empress Gao, Xiao He's wife and Lu's mother were jointly enfeoffed as marquises. This was dismissed in the first year of Xiaowen.

cells.content: 筑陽高后二年，定侯延以何少子封，孝文元年更為酇，二年薨。
cells.literal: Zhuyang Gao Hou second year, Ding Marquis Yan enfeoffed as Xiao He's youngest son, Xiaowen first year changed to Tan, second year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Empress Gao, Ding Marquis Yan was enfeoffed as Xiao He's youngest son; in the first year of Xiaowen, it was changed to Tan. He died in the second year.

cells.content: 煬侯遺嗣，一年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Yang Marquis Yi succeeded, first year died, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Yang Marquis Yi succeeded to the marquisate; died in the first year with no heir.

cells.content: 武陽五年，侯則以何孫遺弟紹封，二十年有罪，免。二萬六千戶。
cells.literal: Wuyang fifth year, Marquis Ze as Xiao He's grandson Yi's younger brother continued the enfeoffment, twentieth year guilty, dismissed. Twenty-six thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Wuyang, Marquis Ze, as Xiao He's grandson Yi's younger brother, continued the enfeoffment; in the twentieth year, he was found guilty and dismissed. His fief had twenty-six thousand households.

cells.content: 孝景二年，侯嘉以則弟紹封，二千戶，七年卒。
cells.literal: Xiaojing second year, Marquis Jia as Ze's younger brother continued enfeoffment, two thousand households, seventh year died.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's second year, Marquis Jia, as Ze's younger brother, continued the enfeoffment with two thousand households; died in the seventh year.

cells.content: 中二年，侯勝嗣，二十一年，坐不齋，耐為隸臣。
cells.literal: Middle second year, Marquis Sheng succeeded; twenty-first year, convicted of not fasting, reduced to servant status.
cells.idiomatic: In the middle second year, Marquis Sheng succeeded to the marquisate; in the twenty-first year, he was convicted of not fasting and reduced to servant status.

cells.content: 酇元狩三年，共侯慶以何曾孫紹封，二千四百戶，三年薨。
cells.literal: Tan Yuanshou third year, Gong Marquis Qing as Xiao He's great-grandson continued enfeoffment, two thousand four hundred households, third year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Yuanshou, Gong Marquis Qing, as Xiao He's great-grandson, continued the enfeoffment with two thousand four hundred households; died in the third year.

cells.content: 六年，侯壽成嗣，十年，坐為太常犧牲瘦，免。
cells.literal: Sixth year, Marquis Shoucheng succeeded; tenth year, convicted of having thin sacrificial animals as Grand Minister of Ceremonies, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Marquis Shoucheng succeeded to the marquisate; in the tenth year, he was convicted of having thin sacrificial animals while serving as Grand Minister of Ceremonies and was dismissed.

cells.content: 地節四年，安侯建世以何玄孫紹封，十四年薨。
cells.literal: Dijie fourth year, An Marquis Jianshi as Xiao He's great-great-grandson continued enfeoffment, fourteenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Dijie, An Marquis Jianshi, as Xiao He's great-great-grandson, continued the enfeoffment; died in the fourteenth year.

cells.content: 六世甘露二年，思侯輔嗣。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Ganlu second year, Si Marquis Fu succeeded.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth generation, during the second year of Ganlu, Si Marquis Fu succeeded to the marquisate.

cells.content: 七世侯獲嗣，永始元年，坐使奴殺人，減死，完為城旦。
cells.literal: Seventh generation Marquis Huo succeeded, Yongshi first year, convicted of sending slave to kill person, death sentence reduced, completed as walled laborer.
cells.idiomatic: In the seventh generation, Marquis Huo succeeded to the marquisate; in the first year of Yongshi, he was convicted of sending a slave to kill a person. His death sentence was reduced and he completed his punishment as a walled laborer.

cells.content: 六世永始元年七月癸卯，釐侯喜以何玄孫之子南读長紹封，三年薨。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yongshi first year seventh month Gui Mao day, Li Marquis Xi as Xiao He's great-great-grandson's son Nan Du Chang continued enfeoffment, third year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth generation, on the Gui Mao day of the seventh month in the first year of Yongshi, Li Marquis Xi, as Xiao He's great-great-grandson's son Nan Du Chang, continued the enfeoffment; died in the third year.

cells.content: 七世永始四年，質侯尊嗣，五年薨。
cells.literal: Seventh generation Yongshi fourth year, Zhi Marquis Zun succeeded, fifth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the seventh generation, during the fourth year of Yongshi, Zhi Marquis Zun succeeded to the marquisate; died in the fifth year.

cells.content: 八世綏和元年，質侯章嗣，元始元年，益封滿二千戶，十三年薨。
cells.literal: Eighth generation Suihe first year, Zhi Marquis Zhang succeeded, Yuanshi first year, additional enfeoffment to two thousand households, thirteenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth generation, during the first year of Suihe, Zhi Marquis Zhang succeeded to the marquisate; in the first year of Yuanshi, his enfeoffment was increased to two thousand households. He died in the thirteenth year.

cells.content: 九世王莽居攝元年，侯禹嗣，建國元年更為蕭鄉侯，莽敗，絕。
cells.literal: Ninth generation Wang Mang Juxuan first year, Marquis Yu succeeded, Jianguo first year changed to Xiao Xiang Marquis, Wang Mang defeated, line extinct.
cells.idiomatic: In the ninth generation, during Wang Mang's first year of Juxuan, Marquis Yu succeeded to the marquisate; in the first year of Jianguo, it was changed to Xiao Xiang Marquis. When Wang Mang was defeated, the line became extinct.

cells.content: 絳武侯周勃
cells.literal: Jiang Wu Marquis Zhou Bo
cells.idiomatic: Jiang Wu Marquis Zhou Bo

cells.content: 以中涓從起沛，至霸上，侯。定三秦，食邑，為將軍，入漢，定隴西，擊項籍，守嶢關，定泗水、東海，侯，八千一百戶。
cells.literal: As attendant-in-ordinary followed uprising from Pei, to Baxiang, made marquis. Pacified the Three Qins, given fief, became general, entered Han, pacified Longxi, attacked Xiang Yu, defended Yaoguan, pacified Sishui and Donghai, made marquis, eight thousand one hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: As an attendant-in-ordinary, he followed the uprising from Pei to Baxiang and was made a marquis. He pacified the Three Qin territories and was given a fief, becoming a general. He entered Han service, pacified Longxi, attacked Xiang Yu, defended Yaoguan Pass, and pacified Sishui and Donghai. He was made a marquis with eight thousand one hundred households.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，三十三年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, thirty-third year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the thirty-third year.

cells.content: 四
cells.literal: Four
cells.idiomatic: Four

cells.content: 孝文十二年，侯勝之嗣，六年，有罪，免。
cells.literal: Xiaowen twelfth year, Marquis Shengzhi succeeded, sixth year, guilty, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's twelfth year, Marquis Shengzhi succeeded to the marquisate; in the sixth year, he was found guilty and dismissed.

cells.content: 修後三年，侯亞夫以勃子紹封，十八年，有罪，免。
cells.literal: Xiu Hou third year, Marquis Yafu as Zhou Bo's son continued enfeoffment, eighteenth year, guilty, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of the Xiu Hou period, Marquis Yafu, as Zhou Bo's son, continued the enfeoffment; in the eighteenth year, he was found guilty and dismissed.

cells.content: 平曲孝景後元年，共侯堅以勃子紹封，十九年薨。
cells.literal: Pingqu Xiaojing Hou first year, Gong Marquis Jian as Zhou Bo's son continued enfeoffment, nineteenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of the Pingqu Xiaojing Hou period, Gong Marquis Jian, as Zhou Bo's son, continued the enfeoffment; died in the nineteenth year.

cells.content: 元朔五年，侯建德嗣，十二年，元鼎五年，坐酎金免。
cells.literal: Yuanshuo fifth year, Marquis Jiande succeeded, twelfth year, Yuanding fifth year, convicted of tribute wine deficiency, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Yuanshuo, Marquis Jiande succeeded to the marquisate; in the twelfth year, during the fifth year of Yuanding, he was convicted of tribute wine deficiency and dismissed.

cells.content: 元康四年，勃曾孫槐里公乘廣漢詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Zhou Bo's great-grandson Huaili Gongcheng Guanghan commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Zhou Bo's great-grandson, Huaili Gongcheng Guanghan, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 元始二年，侯共以勃玄孫紹封，千戶。
cells.literal: Yuanshi second year, Marquis Gong as Zhou Bo's great-great-grandson continued enfeoffment, one thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanshi, Marquis Gong, as Zhou Bo's great-great-grandson, continued the enfeoffment with one thousand households.

cells.content: 舞陽武侯樊噲
cells.literal: Wuyang Wu Marquis Fan Kuai
cells.idiomatic: Wuyang Wu Marquis Fan Kuai

cells.content: 以舍人起沛，從至霸上，為侯。以郎入漢，定三秦，為將軍，擊項籍，再益封。從破燕，執韓信，侯，五千戶。
cells.literal: As retainer rose from Pei, followed to Baxiang, became marquis. As attendant entered Han, pacified the Three Qins, became general, attacked Xiang Yu, enfeoffment increased twice. Followed in breaking Yan, captured Han Xin, made marquis, five thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: As a retainer, he rose up from Pei and followed Liu Bang to Baxiang, becoming a marquis. As an attendant, he entered Han service and pacified the Three Qin territories, becoming a general. He attacked Xiang Yu, and his enfeoffment was increased twice. He followed in breaking Yan and capturing Han Xin. He was made a marquis with five thousand households.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，十三年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, thirteenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the thirteenth year.

cells.content: 五
cells.literal: Five
cells.idiomatic: Five

cells.content: 孝惠七年，侯伉嗣，九年，高后八年，坐呂氏誅。
cells.literal: Xiaohui seventh year, Marquis Kang succeeded, ninth year, Gao Hou eighth year, convicted and executed for Lü clan affair.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Hui's seventh year, Marquis Kang succeeded to the marquisate; in the ninth year, during Empress Gao's eighth year, he was convicted and executed for the Lü clan affair.

cells.content: 孝文元年，荒侯市人以噲子紹封，二十九年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen first year, Huang Marquis Shiren as Fan Kuai's son continued enfeoffment, twenty-ninth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's first year, Huang Marquis Shiren, as Fan Kuai's son, continued the enfeoffment; died in the twenty-ninth year.

cells.content: 孝景七年，侯它廣嗣，中六年，坐非子免。
cells.literal: Xiaojing seventh year, Marquis Taguang succeeded, middle sixth year, convicted of not being legitimate son, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's seventh year, Marquis Taguang succeeded to the marquisate; in the middle sixth year, he was convicted of not being a legitimate son and dismissed.

cells.content: 元康四年，噲曾孫長陵不更勝客詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Fan Kuai's great-grandson Changling Bugeng Shengke commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Fan Kuai's great-grandson, Changling Bugeng Shengke, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 玄孫
cells.literal: Great-great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-great-grandson

cells.content: 六世元始二年，侯章以噲玄孫之子紹封，千戶。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yuanshi second year, Marquis Zhang as Fan Kuai's great-great-grandson's son continued enfeoffment, one thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth generation, during the second year of Yuanshi, Marquis Zhang, as Fan Kuai's great-great-grandson's son, continued the enfeoffment with one thousand households.

cells.content: 曲周景侯酈商
cells.literal: Quzhou Jing Marquis Li Shang
cells.idiomatic: Quzhou Jing Marquis Li Shang

cells.content: 以將軍從起岐，攻長社以南，別定漢及蜀，定三秦，擊項籍，侯，四千八百戶。
cells.literal: As general followed uprising at Qi, attacked south of Changshe, separately pacified Han and Shu, pacified the Three Qins, attacked Xiang Yu, made marquis, four thousand eight hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: As a general, he followed the uprising at Qi and attacked south of Changshe. He separately pacified Han and Shu territories, pacified the Three Qin territories, attacked Xiang Yu, and was made a marquis with four thousand eight hundred households.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，二十二年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, twenty-second year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the twenty-second year.

cells.content: 六
cells.literal: Six
cells.idiomatic: Six

cells.content: 孝文元年，侯寄嗣，三十二年，有罪，免。戶萬八千。
cells.literal: Xiaowen first year, Marquis Ji succeeded, thirty-second year, guilty, dismissed. Households eighteen thousand.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's first year, Marquis Ji succeeded to the marquisate; in the thirty-second year, he was found guilty and dismissed. His fief had eighteen thousand households.

cells.content: 繆孝景中三年，靖侯堅紹封。
cells.literal: Miao Xiaojing middle third year, Jing Marquis Jian continued enfeoffment.
cells.idiomatic: In the middle third year of the Miao Xiaojing period, Jing Marquis Jian continued the enfeoffment.

cells.content: 元光四年，康侯遂成嗣。
cells.literal: Yuanguang fourth year, Kang Marquis Suicheng succeeded.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuanguang, Kang Marquis Suicheng succeeded to the marquisate.

cells.content: 懷侯世宗嗣。
cells.literal: Huai Marquis Shizong succeeded.
cells.idiomatic: Huai Marquis Shizong succeeded to the marquisate.

cells.content: 元鼎二年，侯終根嗣，二十九年，後二年，祝詛上，腰斬。
cells.literal: Yuanding second year, Marquis Zhonggen succeeded, twenty-ninth year, Hou second year, cursed the emperor, executed by waist cut.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanding, Marquis Zhonggen succeeded to the marquisate; in the twenty-ninth year, during the Hou second year, he cursed the emperor and was executed by cutting at the waist.

cells.content: 六世元康四年，商玄孫之子長安公士共詔復家。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yuankang fourth year, Li Shang's great-great-grandson's son Chang'an Gongshi Gong commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth generation, during the fourth year of Yuankang, Li Shang's great-great-grandson's son, Chang'an Gongshi Gong, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 元始二年，詔賜商代後者猛友爵關內侯。
cells.literal: Yuanshi second year, commanded to grant Li Shang's substitute heir Mengyou rank Guan Nei Marquis.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanshi, it was commanded that Li Shang's substitute heir be granted the Mengyou rank of Guan Nei Marquis.

cells.content: 潁陰懿侯灌嬰
cells.literal: Yingyin Yi Marquis Guan Ying
cells.idiomatic: Yingyin Yi Marquis Guan Ying

cells.content: 以中涓從起碭，至霸上，為昌文君，入漢，定三秦，食邑。以將軍屬韓信，定齊、淮南及八邑，殺項籍，侯，五千戶。
cells.literal: As attendant-in-ordinary followed uprising at Dang, to Baxiang, became Changwen Jun, entered Han, pacified the Three Qins, given fief. As general belonged to Han Xin, pacified Qi, Huainan and eight cities, killed Xiang Yu, made marquis, five thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: As an attendant-in-ordinary, he followed the uprising at Dang to Baxiang and became Changwen Jun. He entered Han service and pacified the Three Qin territories, receiving a fief. As a general under Han Xin, he pacified Qi and Huainan territories plus eight cities, and killed Xiang Yu. He was made a marquis with five thousand households.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，二十六年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, twenty-sixth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the twenty-sixth year.

cells.content: 九
cells.literal: Nine
cells.idiomatic: Nine

cells.content: 孝文五年，平侯何嗣，二十八年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen fifth year, Ping Marquis He succeeded, twenty-eighth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's fifth year, Ping Marquis He succeeded to the marquisate; died in the twenty-eighth year.

cells.content: 孝景中三年，侯彊嗣，十三年，有罪，免。戶八千四百。
cells.literal: Xiaojing middle third year, Marquis Qiang succeeded, thirteenth year, guilty, dismissed. Households eight thousand four hundred.
cells.idiomatic: In the middle third year of Emperor Jing, Marquis Qiang succeeded to the marquisate; in the thirteenth year, he was found guilty and dismissed. His fief had eight thousand four hundred households.

cells.content: 臨汝元光二年，侯賢以嬰孫紹封，九年，元朔五年，坐子傷人首匿，免。千戶。
cells.literal: Linru Yuanguang second year, Marquis Xian as Guan Ying's grandson continued enfeoffment, ninth year, Yuanshuo fifth year, convicted of son injuring person and concealing it, dismissed. One thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanguang, Marquis Xian of Linru, as Guan Ying's grandson, continued the enfeoffment; in the ninth year, during the fifth year of Yuanshuo, he was convicted of his son injuring a person and concealing it, and was dismissed. His fief had one thousand households.

cells.content: 元康四年，嬰曾孫長安官首匿詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Guan Ying's great-grandson Chang'an Guan Shouni commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Guan Ying's great-grandson, Chang'an Guan Shouni, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 元壽二年八月，詔賜嬰代後者誼爵關內侯。
cells.literal: Yuanshou second year eighth month, commanded to grant Guan Ying's substitute heir Yi rank Guan Nei Marquis.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth month of the second year of Yuanshou, it was commanded that Guan Ying's substitute heir be granted the Yi rank of Guan Nei Marquis.

cells.content: 汾陰悼侯周昌
cells.literal: Fenyin Dao Marquis Zhou Chang
cells.idiomatic: Fenyin Dao Marquis Zhou Chang

cells.content: 初起，以職志擊秦，入漢，出關，以內史堅守敖倉，以御史大夫侯，比清陽侯。
cells.literal: Initially rose up, with post of clerk attacked Qin, entered Han, left the pass, as interior minister firmly defended Aocang, as censor-in-chief made marquis, comparable to Qingyang Marquis.
cells.idiomatic: He initially rose up and, with the post of clerk, attacked Qin forces. He entered Han service and left the pass. As interior minister, he firmly defended Aocang. As censor-in-chief, he was made a marquis, comparable to the Qingyang Marquis.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，十年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, tenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the tenth year.

cells.content: 十六
cells.literal: Sixteen
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen

cells.content: 孝惠四年，哀侯開方嗣，十六年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaohui fourth year, Ai Marquis Kaifang succeeded, sixteenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Hui's fourth year, Ai Marquis Kaifang succeeded to the marquisate; died in the sixteenth year.

cells.content: 孝文前五年，侯意嗣，十三年，坐行賕，髡為城旦。
cells.literal: Xiaowen before fifth year, Marquis Yi succeeded, thirteenth year, convicted of giving bribes, shaved and made walled laborer.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year before Xiaowen, Marquis Yi succeeded to the marquisate; in the thirteenth year, he was convicted of giving bribes and was shaved and made a walled laborer.

cells.content: 安陽孝景中二年，侯左車以昌孫紹封，八年，建元元年，有罪，免。
cells.literal: Anyang Xiaojing middle second year, Marquis Zuoche as Zhou Chang's grandson continued enfeoffment, eighth year, Jianyuan first year, guilty, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In the middle second year of Emperor Jing, Marquis Zuoche of Anyang, as Zhou Chang's grandson, continued the enfeoffment; in the eighth year, during the first year of Jianyuan, he was found guilty and dismissed.

cells.content: 元康四年，昌曾孫沃侯國士伍明詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Zhou Chang's great-grandson Wo Houguo Shiwu Ming commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Zhou Chang's great-grandson, Wo Houguo Shiwu Ming, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 梁鄒孝侯武虎
cells.literal: Liang Zou Xiao Marquis Wu Hu
cells.idiomatic: Liang Zou Xiao Marquis Wu Hu

cells.content: 兵初起，以謁者從擊破秦，入漢，定三秦，出關，以將軍擊定諸侯，比博陽侯，二千八百戶。
cells.literal: When troops first rose, as usher followed in attacking and breaking Qin, entered Han, pacified the Three Qins, left the pass, as general attacked and pacified the lords, comparable to Boyang Marquis, two thousand eight hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: When troops first rose up, he followed as an usher in attacking and breaking Qin forces. He entered Han service and pacified the Three Qin territories. He left the pass and, as a general, attacked and pacified the other lords. He was comparable to the Boyang Marquis with two thousand eight hundred households.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，十一年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, eleventh year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the eleventh year.

cells.content: 二十
cells.literal: Twenty
cells.idiomatic: Twenty

cells.content: 孝惠五年，侯最嗣，五十八年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaohui fifth year, Marquis Zui succeeded, fifty-eighth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Hui's fifth year, Marquis Zui succeeded to the marquisate; died in the fifty-eighth year.

cells.content: 元光三年，頃侯嬰齊嗣，二十年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanguang third year, Qing Marquis Yingqi succeeded, twentieth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Yuanguang, Qing Marquis Yingqi succeeded to the marquisate; died in the twentieth year.

cells.content: 元鼎四年，侯山柎嗣，一年，坐酎金免。
cells.literal: Yuanding fourth year, Marquis Shanfen succeeded, first year, convicted of tribute wine deficiency, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuanding, Marquis Shanfen succeeded to the marquisate; in the first year, he was convicted of tribute wine deficiency and dismissed.

cells.content: 玄孫
cells.literal: Great-great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-great-grandson

cells.content: 六世元康四年，虎玄孫之子夫夷侯國公乘充竟詔復家。
cells.literal: Sixth generation Yuankang fourth year, Wu Hu's great-great-grandson's son Fu Yi Houguo Gongcheng Chongjing commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth generation, during the fourth year of Yuankang, Wu Hu's great-great-grandson's son, Fu Yi Houguo Gongcheng Chongjing, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 成敬侯董渫
cells.literal: Cheng Jing Marquis Dong Xi
cells.idiomatic: Cheng Jing Marquis Dong Xi

cells.content: 初起以舍人從擊秦，為都尉，入漢，定三秦，出關，以將軍定諸侯，比厭次侯，二千八百戶。
cells.literal: Initially rose as retainer followed in attacking Qin, became commander, entered Han, pacified the Three Qins, left the pass, as general pacified the lords, comparable to Yanci Marquis, two thousand eight hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: He initially rose up as a retainer and followed in attacking Qin forces, becoming a commander. He entered Han service and pacified the Three Qin territories. He left the pass and, as a general, pacified the other lords. He was comparable to the Yanci Marquis with two thousand eight hundred households.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，七年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, seventh year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the seventh year.

cells.content: 二十五
cells.literal: Twenty-five
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-five

cells.content: 節氏孝惠元年，康侯赤嗣，四十四年，有罪，免。戶五千六百。孝景中五年，赤復封，八年薨。
cells.literal: Jie Shi Xiaohui first year, Kang Marquis Chi succeeded, forty-fourth year, guilty, dismissed. Households five thousand six hundred. Xiaojing middle fifth year, Chi re-enfeoffed, eighth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Xiaohui, Kang Marquis Chi of Jie Shi succeeded to the marquisate; in the forty-fourth year, he was found guilty and dismissed. His fief had five thousand six hundred households. In the middle fifth year of Xiaojing, Chi was re-enfeoffed and died in the eighth year.

cells.content: 建元四年，共侯罷軍嗣，五年薨。
cells.literal: Jianyuan fourth year, Gong Marquis Baju succeeded, fifth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Jianyuan, Gong Marquis Baju succeeded to the marquisate; died in the fifth year.

cells.content: 元光三年，侯朝嗣，十二年，元狩三年，坐為濟南太守與城陽王女通，耐為鬼薪。
cells.literal: Yuanguang third year, Marquis Chao succeeded, twelfth year, Yuanshou third year, convicted of as Jinan governor having relations with Chengyang King's daughter, reduced to ghost salary laborer.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Yuanguang, Marquis Chao succeeded to the marquisate; in the twelfth year, during the third year of Yuanshou, he was convicted of having relations with the Chengyang King's daughter while serving as governor of Jinan, and was reduced to a ghost salary laborer.

cells.content: 元康四年，渫玄孫平陵公乘詘詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Dong Xi's great-great-grandson Pingling Gongcheng Qu commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Dong Xi's great-great-grandson, Pingling Gongcheng Qu, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 蓼夷侯孔聚
cells.literal: Liao Yi Marquis Kong Ju
cells.idiomatic: Liao Yi Marquis Kong Ju

cells.content: 以執盾前元年從起碭，以左司馬入漢，為將軍，三以都尉擊項籍，屬韓信，侯。
cells.literal: As shield bearer previous first year followed uprising at Dang, as left marshal entered Han, became general, three times as commander attacked Xiang Yu, belonged to Han Xin, made marquis.
cells.idiomatic: As a shield bearer in the previous first year, he followed the uprising at Dang and entered Han as left marshal, becoming a general. Three times he attacked Xiang Yu as a commander, belonging to Han Xin, and was made a marquis.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，三十年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, thirtieth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the thirtieth year.

cells.content: 三十
cells.literal: Thirty
cells.idiomatic: Thirty

cells.content: 孝文九年，侯臧嗣，四十五年，元朔三年，坐為太常衣冠道橋壞不得度，免。
cells.literal: Xiaowen ninth year, Marquis Zang succeeded, forty-fifth year, Yuanshuo third year, convicted of as Grand Minister of Ceremonies clothing crown road bridge broken unable to cross, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's ninth year, Marquis Zang succeeded to the marquisate; in the forty-fifth year, during the third year of Yuanshuo, he was convicted of allowing the bridge on the ceremonial clothing road to be broken and impassable while serving as Grand Minister of Ceremonies, and was dismissed.

cells.content: 孫
cells.literal: Grandson
cells.idiomatic: Grandson

cells.content: 曾孫
cells.literal: Great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-grandson

cells.content: 元康四年，聚玄孫長安公士宣詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Kong Ju's great-great-grandson Chang'an Gongshi Xuan commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Kong Ju's great-great-grandson, Chang'an Gongshi Xuan, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 費侯陳賀
cells.literal: Fei Marquis Chen He
cells.idiomatic: Fei Marquis Chen He

cells.content: 以舍人前元年從起碭，以左司馬入漢，用都尉屬韓信，擊項籍，為將軍，定會稽、浙江、湖陵，侯。
cells.literal: As retainer previous first year followed uprising at Dang, as left marshal entered Han, used commander belonged to Han Xin, attacked Xiang Yu, became general, pacified Kuaiji, Zhejiang, Huling, made marquis.
cells.idiomatic: As a retainer in the previous first year, he followed the uprising at Dang and entered Han as left marshal. He used his position as commander to belong to Han Xin, attacked Xiang Yu, became a general, and pacified Kuaiji, Zhejiang, and Huling territories. He was made a marquis.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，二十二年薨。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, twenty-second year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; died in the twenty-second year.

cells.content: 三十一
cells.literal: Thirty-one
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-one

cells.content: 孝文元年，共侯常嗣，二十四年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen first year, Gong Marquis Chang succeeded, twenty-fourth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's first year, Gong Marquis Chang succeeded to the marquisate; died in the twenty-fourth year.

cells.content: 孝景二年，侯偃嗣，八年，有罪，免。
cells.literal: Xiaojing second year, Marquis Yan succeeded, eighth year, guilty, dismissed.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's second year, Marquis Yan succeeded to the marquisate; in the eighth year, he was found guilty and dismissed.

cells.content: 巢孝景中六年，侯最以賀子紹封，二年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Chao Xiaojing middle sixth year, Marquis Zui as Chen He's son continued enfeoffment, second year died, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In the middle sixth year of Emperor Jing, Marquis Zui of Chao, as Chen He's son, continued the enfeoffment; died in the second year with no heir.

cells.content: 元康四年，賀曾孫茂陵上造僑詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Chen He's great-grandson Maoling Shangzao Qiao commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Chen He's great-grandson, Maoling Shangzao Qiao, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 陽夏侯陳豨
cells.literal: Yangxia Marquis Chen Xi
cells.idiomatic: Yangxia Marquis Chen Xi

cells.content: 以特將將卒五百人前元年從起宛朐，至霸上，為游擊將軍，別定代，破臧荼，侯。
cells.literal: As special general leading five hundred soldiers previous first year followed uprising at Wanqu, to Baxiang, became roaming attack general, separately pacified Dai, broke Zang Tu, made marquis.
cells.idiomatic: As a special general leading five hundred soldiers in the previous first year, he followed the uprising at Wanqu to Baxiang, became a roaming attack general, separately pacified Dai territory, broke Zang Tu, and was made a marquis.

cells.content: 正月丙午封，十年，以趙相國反，自為王，十二年，誅。
cells.literal: First month Bing Wu day enfeoffed, tenth year, as Zhao chancellor rebelled, self-made king, twelfth year, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bing Wu day of the first month; in the tenth year, as Zhao chancellor he rebelled and made himself king. He was executed in the twelfth year.

cells.content: 隆慮克侯周灶
cells.literal: Longlu Ke Marquis Zhou Zao
cells.idiomatic: Longlu Ke Marquis Zhou Zao

cells.content: 以卒從起碭，以連敖入漢，以長⓪都尉擊項籍，侯。
cells.literal: As soldier followed uprising at Dang, as Lian Ao entered Han, as chief commander attacked Xiang Yu, made marquis.
cells.idiomatic: As a soldier, he followed the uprising at Dang and entered Han as Lian Ao, becoming chief commander. He attacked Xiang Yu and was made a marquis.

cells.content: 正月丁未封，三十九年薨。
cells.literal: First month Ding Wei day enfeoffed, thirty-ninth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Ding Wei day of the first month; died in the thirty-ninth year.

cells.content: 三十四
cells.literal: Thirty-four
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-four

cells.content: 孝文後二年，侯通嗣，十二年，孝景中元年，有罪，完為城旦。
cells.literal: Xiaowen Hou second year, Marquis Tong succeeded, twelfth year, Xiaojing middle first year, guilty, completed as walled laborer.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of the Xiaowen Hou period, Marquis Tong succeeded to the marquisate; in the twelfth year, during the middle first year of Xiaojing, he was found guilty and completed his punishment as a walled laborer.

cells.content: 孫
cells.literal: Grandson
cells.idiomatic: Grandson

cells.content: 曾孫
cells.literal: Great-grandson
cells.idiomatic: Great-grandson

cells.content: 元康四年，灶玄孫陽陵公乘詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Zhou Zao's great-great-grandson Yangling Gongcheng commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Zhou Zao's great-great-grandson, Yangling Gongcheng, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 陽都敬侯丁復
cells.literal: Yangdu Jing Marquis Ding Fu
cells.idiomatic: Yangdu Jing Marquis Ding Fu

cells.content: 以越將從起薛，至霸上，以樓煩將入漢，定三秦，屬周呂侯，破龍且彭城，為大司馬，破項籍葉，為將軍，忠臣，侯，七千八百戶。
cells.literal: As Yue general followed uprising at Xue, to Baxiang, as Loufan general entered Han, pacified the Three Qins, belonged to Zhou Lü Hou, broke Long Ju at Pengcheng, became grand marshal, broke Xiang Yu at Ye, became general, loyal minister, made marquis, seven thousand eight hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: As a Yue general, he followed the uprising at Xue to Baxiang, entered Han as Loufan general, and pacified the Three Qin territories. He belonged to Zhou Lü Hou, broke Long Ju at Pengcheng, became grand marshal, broke Xiang Yu at Ye, became a general, proved to be a loyal minister, and was made a marquis with seven thousand eight hundred households.

cells.content: 正月戊申封，十九年薨。
cells.literal: First month Wu Shen day enfeoffed, nineteenth year died.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Wu Shen day of the first month; died in the nineteenth year.

cells.content: 十七
cells.literal: Seventeen
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen

cells.content: 高后六年，趮侯甯嗣，十二年薨。
cells.literal: Gao Hou sixth year, Yao Marquis Ning succeeded, twelfth year died.
cells.idiomatic: In Empress Gao's sixth year, Yao Marquis Ning succeeded to the marquisate; died in the twelfth year.

cells.content: 孝文十年，侯安城嗣，十五年，孝景二年，有罪，免。戶萬七千。
cells.literal: Xiaowen tenth year, Marquis Ancheng succeeded, fifteenth year, Xiaojing second year, guilty, dismissed. Households seventeen thousand.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's tenth year, Marquis Ancheng succeeded to the marquisate; in the fifteenth year, during the second year of Xiaojing, he was found guilty and dismissed. His fief had seventeen thousand households.

cells.content: 元康四年，復曾孫臨沂公士賜詔復家。
cells.literal: Yuankang fourth year, Ding Fu's great-grandson Linyi Gongshi Ci commanded to restore the family.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuankang, Ding Fu's great-grandson, Linyi Gongshi Ci, was commanded to restore the family line.

cells.content: 陽信胡侯呂青
cells.literal: Yangxin Hu Marquis Lü Qing
cells.idiomatic: Yangxin Hu Marquis Lü Qing

cells.content: 以漢五年用令尹初從，功比堂邑侯，千戶。
